page.title: 19Children's Games
page.content: We picked two girls from another class and asked them questions about hand clapping games. One of them knew five and the other knew four. They learnt them in their previous class. The favourite of them all is "see-see". The second favourite is "A Sailor". The words to "See-See" are 'See see my Granny come out and play with me, my sister's got the 'flu, chickenpox and measles too. Slide down the drainpipe, crawl the kitchen door, I'll be your best of friends for evermore, more, shut that door, number sixty-four, oy!' The hand actions are cupping hands, clap your partner's hands, clap twice, clap back of hands together and repeat.
